meanings.definition: The edge of a woven fabric that prevents it from unraveling.
meanings.sent1: The selvedges of the blanket were neatly stitched to keep the threads from coming loose.
meanings.sent2: She trimmed the selvedges of the tablecloth to give it a clean and tidy finish.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the selvedges of the rug, thinking they were yarn.
meanings.sent4: The selvedges of society hold us together, preventing chaos from taking over.
meanings.sent5: The bright red selvedges of the flag fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.definition: The finished edge of a piece of fabric.
meanings.sent1: Mom carefully hemmed the selvedges of the dress to make it look polished.
meanings.sent2: The selvedges of the curtains added a nice touch to the room's decor.
meanings.sent3: The chef used the selvedges of the tablecloth to create a unique napkin design.
meanings.sent4: The selvedges of the quilt held memories of the hands that crafted it.
meanings.sent5: The delicate lace selvedges of the handkerchief made it a cherished keepsake.
